# Sagemind AI — Marketing Plan
## Web Design & AI Solutions Division
*February 2026*

---

## 1. Marketing Objectives

| Objective | Target | Timeline |
|-----------|--------|----------|
| Build prospect pipeline | 100+ qualified leads | Month 1–3 |
| Convert first clients | 3–5 paying clients | Month 2–3 |
| Establish local presence | Chamber membership + 2 networking events/mo | Month 2+ |
| Build social proof | 3 case studies + 5 testimonials | Month 3–6 |
| Launch Costa Rica outreach | 10+ dental/medical clinic contacts | Month 6–9 |
| Achieve steady pipeline | 3–5 new inquiries per month | Month 6+ |

---

## 2. Target Audience Profiles

### Profile A: Local Tradesperson (Bay Area)
- **Who:** HVAC tech, plumber, electrician, landscaper, contractor
- **Age:** 35–55
- **Pain:** Gets calls from Google Maps but loses jobs to competitors with websites
- **Objection:** "I get enough work from word-of-mouth"
- **Counter:** "Your competitors' websites are capturing the customers who DON'T know you yet"
- **Channel:** Google Maps prospecting, cold call/email, Chamber events

### Profile B: Salon / Beauty Business Owner
- **Who:** Hair salon, nail salon, spa, barber shop, esthetician
- **Age:** 28–50
- **Pain:** Manages bookings via phone/Instagram DMs, loses after-hours customers
- **Objection:** "My Instagram IS my website"
- **Counter:** "30–40% of bookings happen when you're closed. An online booking system captures those automatically."
- **Channel:** Instagram DM, local networking, referral from existing salon client

### Profile C: Costa Rica Dental/Medical Clinic
- **Who:** Dentist, cosmetic surgeon, wellness clinic operator
- **Age:** 35–60
- **Pain:** Wants to attract American dental tourists but website is in Spanish only or doesn't exist
- **Objection:** "I get patients through referrals already"
- **Counter:** "55,000+ Americans search for Costa Rica dental tourism every year. A professional English site captures patients your referrals never reach."
- **Channel:** Dental City referral, direct outreach via email/WhatsApp, dental association contacts

---

## 3. Marketing Channels & Tactics

### Phase 1: Foundation (Month 1–2)

#### A. Portfolio & Case Studies
- Create dedicated web design services page on sagemindai.io
- Build Dental City case study (challenge → solution → results)
- Build salon booking case study
- Add testimonial request to current client workflow
- **Key stat:** 66% of B2B marketers say case studies are a top-3 content type for lead generation

#### B. Google Maps Prospecting
- Search target business types in East Bay cities (Castro Valley, Hayward, San Leandro, Fremont, Union City)
- Identify businesses with Google listings but no website link
- Build spreadsheet: Business name, category, phone, email, Google rating, notes
- **Target:** 50–100 qualified prospects in first 2 weeks
- **Tools:** Manual search (free) or Targetron/Outscraper for scale

#### C. Online Presence Optimization
- Optimize Sagemind Google Business Profile
- Add web design services to LinkedIn company page
- Create "Before & After" portfolio content for social media

---

### Phase 2: Outreach & Networking (Month 2–4)

#### D. Cold Email Campaign
- **Volume:** Start with 50–100 highly targeted emails, test, then scale
- **Personalization:** Reference their specific Google listing, reviews, and missing website
- **Follow-up:** 2–3 follow-ups spaced 3–5 days apart, each adding value
- **Key stat:** Personalized cold emails get 26% higher open rates

**Email Template Framework:**

```
Subject: Your [Business Name] Google listing is missing something

Hi [Name],

I found [Business Name] on Google Maps and noticed you have [X] great reviews 
but no website linked to your listing.

Businesses like yours that add a professional website see 100–500% more leads 
from their Google presence.

I built a quick mockup of what your site could look like: [link]

Would you be open to a 15-minute call this week?

— Justin, Sagemind AI
```

#### E. Free Audit / Mockup Strategy
- For highest-value prospects, build a quick landing page mockup showing what their site COULD look like
- Send as a "gift" — no obligation
- **This is the #1 conversion tactic** — it makes the abstract tangible
- Time investment: 30–60 min per mockup (use templates)

#### F. Local Networking
- **Join:** East Bay SBDC, Hayward Chamber of Commerce, Castro Valley Chamber
- **Attend:** 2 networking events per month minimum
- **Offer:** Free "Website Audit" workshops for chamber members
- **Key stat:** 49% of agencies cite strategic alliances as fastest-growing lead source

#### G. Referral Program
- Offer existing clients $250–$500 credit for each referral that converts
- Ask Dental City for introductions to other clinics
- Partner with complementary service providers (photographers, marketing consultants, bookkeepers)

---

### Phase 3: Content & Authority (Month 3–6)

#### H. Content Marketing
- Blog posts on sagemindai.io targeting search terms:
  - "Does my [trade] business need a website?"
  - "Best dental tourism websites in Costa Rica"
  - "How much does a small business website cost in 2026?"
  - "Online booking for salons — why you're losing customers"
- Repurpose into LinkedIn posts and short-form social content
- **Goal:** 2 posts per month

#### I. Social Proof Flywheel
- After each project completion:
  1. Request Google review
  2. Request testimonial quote
  3. Create before/after case study
  4. Share on LinkedIn + social
- **Target:** 3 published case studies by Month 6

#### J. LinkedIn Strategy
- Justin posts 2–3x/week about AI web design insights
- Share client wins, before/after reveals, industry statistics
- Connect with local business owners, chamber members, trade associations
- Comment on posts from target industries

---

### Phase 4: Costa Rica Expansion (Month 6–9)

#### K. Dental Tourism Outreach
- Use Dental City as the portfolio anchor
- Research Costa Rica dental association directories for clinic contacts
- Outreach via email and WhatsApp (preferred communication in CR)
- Offer bilingual site packages specifically for dental tourism
- Attend or sponsor dental tourism events/conferences (virtual initially)

#### L. Expanded Tourism Targets
- Wellness retreats, surf camps, adventure tourism operators
- Expat service businesses (legal, real estate, relocation)
- These businesses all need English-language sites to reach international customers

---

### Phase 5: Scale & Systematize (Month 9–12)

#### M. Paid Advertising (when organic pipeline is proven)
- Google Ads targeting "web design [city]" and "website for [industry]"
- Facebook/Instagram ads with before/after portfolio examples
- **Budget:** $300–$500/mo to start
- Only launch after organic pipeline proves the offer converts

#### N. Template Library
- Build 3–5 industry-specific website templates (trades, salon, dental, restaurant)
- Reduces delivery time from 3–4 weeks to 1–2 weeks
- Enables Starter tier pricing while maintaining quality

#### O. Process Automation
- Standardized onboarding questionnaire
- Project management workflow (intake → design → review → launch)
- Automated follow-up sequences for leads
- Client portal for revisions and communication

---

## 6. Competitive Positioning Statement

> **For small businesses that need more than a template but can't afford a big agency,** Sagemind AI builds AI-enhanced websites that actually grow your business — with smart booking, chatbots, and SEO that works — delivered in weeks, not months, at a price that makes sense.
